{"step_by_step_thinking": "A postdated pregnancy is one that has extended beyond 42 weeks. The first step in managing a postdated pregnancy is to confirm the gestational age. This is because errors in dating the pregnancy could be the reason for the apparent post-term pregnancy. The best way to confirm gestational age is through an ultrasound scan (USG), which can provide accurate dating of the pregnancy.", "answer_choice": "D"}
